question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to move the cursor one word to the left in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
option_1: Ctrl + Left arrow key
option_2: Shift + Left arrow key
solution:
• The shortcut key used to move the cursor one word to the left in MS-Word 365 is Ctrl + Left arrow key.
  • Pressing Ctrl + Left arrow key jumps the cursor to the beginning of the previous word, allowing faster navigation.
  • Other options like Shift + Left arrow key, Shift + PageUp, and Ctrl + PageUp perform different selection or scrolling functions.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + Left arrow key helps in efficient text editing and navigation.
  • It is useful for quickly moving through large documents word by word.
  • Familiarity with navigation shortcuts improves productivity.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to display the font dialog box in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to display the Font dialog box in MS Word 365 is Ctrl + D.
  • Ctrl + F is used for Find function.
  • Alt + F opens the File menu.
  • Alt + D is generally not assigned to the Font dialog box.

Additional Information:

  • The Font dialog box allows users to change font style, size, color, effects, and other text formatting options.
  • Using Ctrl + D is a quick way to access these font settings without navigating through the Ribbon.
  • Knowing shortcut keys improves productivity in MS Word.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to copy the selected data in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to copy the selected data in MS Word 365 is Ctrl + C.
  • Ctrl + X is used to cut the selected data, not copy.
  • Alt + C and Alt + X are not used for copying data in Word.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + C copies the selected text or object to the clipboard without removing it from the document.
  • This shortcut is essential for duplicating text, images, or other content quickly.
  • Knowing basic shortcuts like Copy, Cut, and Paste (Ctrl + V) enhances productivity in Word.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key displays the Editor task pane to check spelling and grammar in the document or the selected text in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to display the Editor task pane for checking spelling and grammar in MS Word 365 is F7.
  • F1 opens the Help pane.
  • F2 is used to rename a selected object or text.
  • F10 activates the Ribbon menu.

Additional Information:

  • Pressing F7 runs the spell check and grammar check tool, helping to find and correct errors in the document.
  • The Editor task pane provides suggestions to improve writing clarity and style.
  • Using this shortcut speeds up the proofreading process in Word.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to print a file in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to print a file in MS Word 365 is Ctrl + P.
  • Alt + P is used to open the Design tab in the Ribbon.
  • Shift + P is not a standard shortcut for printing.
  • Ctrl + Alt + P is not used for printing in Word.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + P opens the print dialog box where you can select printer settings and print the document.
  • This shortcut saves time instead of navigating through the File menu.
  • Familiarity with printing shortcuts improves document handling efficiency.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to open a new file in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to open a new file (create a new document) in MS Word 365 is Ctrl + N.
  • Ctrl + O is used to open an existing file.
  • Alt + N opens the Insert tab in the Ribbon.
  • Alt + O opens the Format tab in older versions but not used for new file creation.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + N quickly starts a new blank document.
  • This shortcut saves time compared to navigating menus.
  • Knowing this shortcut improves workflow efficiency in Word.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a type of paragraph formatting in MS-Word 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• Precise is NOT a type of paragraph formatting in MS Word 365.
  • Right, Centre, and Justify are standard paragraph alignment options.
  • Right aligns text to the right margin.
  • Centre aligns text to the center.
  • Justify aligns text evenly along both left and right margins.

Additional Information:

  • Paragraph formatting mainly involves alignment, indentation, spacing, and line breaks.
  • The term Precise does not refer to any alignment or paragraph formatting option in Word.
  • Knowing valid paragraph formats helps in proper document formatting.

question:
Which among the following keyboard shortcuts is used to insert a hyperlink for the selected text in Microsoft Word?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The shortcut key to insert a hyperlink for the selected text in Microsoft Word is Ctrl + K.
  • Ctrl + M is used to increase paragraph indent.
  • Ctrl + H opens the Find and Replace dialog box.
  • Ctrl + Z is used to undo the last action.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + K opens the Insert Hyperlink dialog where you can add or edit hyperlinks.
  • Hyperlinks can link to web pages, email addresses, or other documents.
  • This shortcut saves time by quickly adding links without using the Ribbon.

question:
Which of the following option of print setting is used to choose only specific pages in MS-Word 365?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The correct print setting option to choose only specific pages in MS Word 365 is Custom Print.
  • Print Current Page prints only the page currently displayed.
  • Print All Pages prints the entire document.
  • Print Selection prints only the text or content currently selected.

Additional Information:

  • Custom Print allows users to specify page numbers or page ranges (e.g., 2-5, 7, 10-12) to print.
  • This option is useful when you do not want to print the whole document.
  • Knowing print options helps in saving paper and ink by printing only necessary pages.

question:
Shading option in MS-Word 365 is used for ____________.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
option_1: Changing the color behind the selected text
option_2: Making the text pop by highlighting it
option_3: Changing the color of the selected text
option_4: Changing the color around the selected text
solution:
• The Shading option in MS Word 365 is used for changing the color behind the selected text (i.e., background color).
  • It does not change the text color itself; that is done by the Font Color option.
  • It highlights the background behind the text to make it stand out without altering the text color.
  • It is different from the Highlight tool, which applies a transparent color effect.

Additional Information:

  • Shading helps in emphasizing or differentiating parts of the text by adding a background color.
  • This option is often used in tables, paragraphs, or sections for visual clarity.
  • Knowing shading vs. highlighting differences improves document formatting skills.

question:
Which of the following font effects is not available in the MS-Word 2010 font dialog box?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Equalize Character Height is NOT available as a font effect in the MS Word 2010 font dialog box.
  • Superscript, Double Strikethrough, and Small Caps are available font effects in Word.
  • These effects modify the appearance of the selected text in various ways.

Additional Information:

  • Superscript raises the text above the normal line.
  • Double Strikethrough draws two lines through the text.
  • Small Caps converts lowercase letters to small uppercase letters.
  • Equalize Character Height is not a standard font effect in Word and does not appear in the dialog.

question:
Which of the following statement(s) about Quick Access Toolbar in MS-Word 2010 is/are incorrect?

P: The Quick Access Toolbar has Save, Undo, and Redo buttons by default.

Q: The Quick Access Toolbar has Cut, Undo, and Redo buttons by default.

R: You can place more buttons on the Quick Access Toolbar.

S: There is no option on Quick Access Toolbar for “Show below the Ribbon.”

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
option_1: Only Q and S
option_2: All P, Q, R, S
option_3: Only Q and R
option_4: Only P, Q, R
solution:
• Statements Q and S about the Quick Access Toolbar in MS Word 2010 are incorrect.
  • Q is incorrect because the default buttons on the Quick Access Toolbar are Save, Undo, and Redo, not Cut.
  • S is incorrect because there is an option to “Show Quick Access Toolbar below the Ribbon”.
  • Statements P and R are correct.
    • P: Save, Undo, and Redo are default buttons.
    • R: You can add more buttons to the Quick Access Toolbar.

Additional Information:

  • The Quick Access Toolbar provides easy access to frequently used commands.
  • You can customize its position and the commands it contains.
  • Understanding default and customizable options improves user efficiency.

question:
Which of the following keyboard shortcut is used to close a MS-Word 365 document?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The keyboard shortcut to close a MS-Word 365 document is Alt + F4.
  • Alt + F3 is used to create a building block.
  • Shift + F5 moves the cursor to the last editing point.
  • Ctrl + F3 cuts text to the Spike (a special clipboard).

Additional Information:

  • Alt + F4 closes the active window or document.
  • If the document has unsaved changes, Word will prompt to save before closing.
  • This shortcut also works to close other Windows applications.

question:
Which of the following buttons are present in the Quick Access Toolbar by default in MS-Word 2010?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The buttons present in the Quick Access Toolbar by default in MS Word 2010 are Save, Undo, and Redo.
  • Paste, Redo, Copy are not the default buttons.
  • Undo, Redo, Cut is incorrect because Cut is not included by default.
  • Undo, Redo, Name is incorrect; "Name" is not a toolbar button.

Additional Information:

  • Quick Access Toolbar provides quick access to commonly used commands.
  • Users can customize it to add or remove buttons as per their convenience.
  • Knowing default buttons helps in familiarizing with Word's basic features.

question:
Consider the following statements regarding line spacing of a paragraph in MS-Word 2010:

P: Line spacing determines the amount of vertical space between lines of text in a paragraph.

Q: Line spacing determines the amount of diagonal space between lines of text in a paragraph.

Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
option_2: Both P and Q
option_3: Neither P nor Q
solution:
• Statement P is correct: Line spacing determines the amount of vertical space between lines of text in a paragraph.
  • Statement Q is incorrect: Line spacing does not refer to diagonal space.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is Only P.

Additional Information:

  • Adjusting line spacing affects readability and appearance of text.
  • Common line spacing options include single, 1.5 lines, double, etc.
  • Proper line spacing improves document formatting and clarity.

question:
In MS Word 365, while working with the text, the Thesaurus tool is used for:

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: correct the format of the text
option_2: check for synonyms and antonyms
option_3: finding repeated words in the document
solution:
• The Thesaurus tool in MS Word is used to look up synonyms (words with similar meanings) and antonyms (words with opposite meanings).
  • It helps users enhance their vocabulary and make their writing more expressive.

Additional Information:

  • You can access Thesaurus through the Review tab→ Thesaurus , or by right-clicking a word→ Synonyms .
  • This tool is especially useful for students, content writers, and professionals aiming to avoid repetitive word usage.

question:
Which of the following options allows you to change page orientation in MS Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, to change the page orientation (from portrait to landscape or vice versa), you go to the Page Layout tab.
  • From there, you can select the Orientation option and choose either Portrait or Landscape .

Additional Information:

  • The Page Layout tab includes tools for setting margins , size , columns , and orientation .
  • This setting affects how the entire page appears when printed or viewed.

question:
What feature in Microsoft Word 365 allows you to create a numbered list with different levels of indentation?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Multilevel numbering in MS Word allows users to create hierarchical numbered lists , such as 1, 1.1, 1.1.1, etc.
  • It is used for outlining documents, creating structured headings, or legal/technical lists with subpoints.

Additional Information:

  • You can access this feature from the Home tab→ Multilevel List button .
  • It helpsorganise content clearly, especially in large documents with sections and subsections.

question:
Which of the following keyboard shortcut keys is used to copy the selected text in MS Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, Ctrl + C is the shortcut used to copy the selected text or item to the clipboard.
  • The copied text can then be pasted elsewhere using Ctrl + V .

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + X is used to cut the selected text.
  • Ctrl + P is used to print the document.
  • Ctrl + V is used to paste the copied or cut content.

question:
Which of the following is the purpose of the "Zoom" icon in Microsoft Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: To change the document's page layout
option_2: To increase the font size
option_3: Toadjustthe visual appearance of our document to suit our reading or editing needs
option_4: To delete the current page
solution:
• The Zoom icon in MS Word 365 is used to adjust how large or small the content appears on the screen.
  • It helpscustomise the view for better readability or editing comfort , without changing the actual size of the text or layout.

Additional Information:

  • You can access the Zoom feature from the View tab→ Zoom , or by using the slider in the bottom-right corner of the window.
  • It does not affect the printed output of the document.

question:
What is the purpose of the ‘Drag-and-Drop’ method in Microsoft Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_4: To copy or move text by dragging it to a new location
solution:
• The Drag-and-Drop method in MS Word allows users to move or copy text by selecting it, dragging it with the mouse, and dropping it at the desired location .
  • This is a quick way to rearrange content without using copy-paste shortcuts.

Additional Information:

  • To move the text, drag it normally.
  • To copy the text using drag-and-drop, press and hold the Ctrl key while dragging.
  • This feature improves editing speed and user convenience.

question:
What is the shortcut command in MS Word 365 for cutting the text?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, Ctrl + X is the shortcut used to cut selected text, removing it from its original position and placing it on the clipboard.
  • You can then paste it elsewhere using Ctrl + V .

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + C is used to copy text.
  • Ctrl + V is used to paste copied or cut content.
  • Ctrl + Z is used to undo the last action.

question:
How do we move a piece of text from one place to another in Microsoft Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• To move text in MS Word, the correct method is to use Cut and Paste .
  • Cut removes the text from its original location, and Paste inserts it at the new desired location.

Additional Information:

  • Copy and Paste creates a duplicate of the text but does not move it.
  • There is no built-in command called Insert related to text movement like Cut or Copy in Word.

question:
In MS Word 365, which feature allows you to create a new document quickly using a predefined layout?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A Document Template in MS Word 365 allows users to quickly create new documents based on a pre-designed structure and formatting .
  • It saves time by avoiding repetitive formatting work.
  • Templates can include styles, headings, fonts, and placeholders.

Additional Information:

  • Print Layout View only changes how the document is displayed, not created.
  • Spelling and Grammar Check corrects language errors.
  • AutoSave saves the document automatically but doesn't help with document creation.

question:
In MS Word 365, which statement accurately describes the difference between bullets and numbering in document formatting?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Bullets and numbering both serve the same purpose and can be used interchangeably.
option_2: Bullets and numbering are not applicable in document formatting and are used for graphic design purposes.
option_3: Bullets can be applied to individual paragraphs, while numbering applies only to entire sections.
option_4: Bullets are used for unordered lists, while numbering is used for ordered lists.
solution:
• In MS Word 365, Bullets are used for unordered lists , where the order of items doesn’t matter (e.g., shopping list).
  • Numbering is used for ordered lists , where sequence or priority is important (e.g., steps in a process).
  • Both features help structure content clearly.

Additional Information:

  • Bullets use symbols like •,○ , or squares, while numbering uses 1, 2, 3 or a, b, c.
  • These tools are found under the Home tab→ Paragraph group .
  • They are especially useful in making content easier to scan and understand .

question:
In MS-Word 365, which option allows you to apply a specific style to a selected portion of text?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Character Style allows you to apply formatting—like font, font size, bold, italic,colour , etc. —only to the selected text .
  • It does not affect the formatting of surrounding or unselected text.
  • It is used when you want consistent styling for particular phrases or words across the document.

Additional Information:

  • Format Painter copies formatting from one place to another.
  • Clear Formatting removes all applied formatting from the selected text.
  • Quick Style applies predefined sets of styles often affecting larger blocks like paragraphs.

question:
Which action should be taken to copy and paste text within a MS Word 365 document?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Select the text, press ‘Ctrl+C’ to copy, and ‘Ctrl+V’ to paste it to the desired location.
option_2: Delete the text and retype it in the desired location to move it.
option_3: Drag and drop the text to the desired location within the document.
option_4: Use the ‘Find and Replace’ function to copy and move text to the desired location.
solution:
• The correct method to copy and paste text in MS Word 365 is to select the text , press Ctrl + C to copy it, then move the cursor and press Ctrl + V to paste it.
  • This creates a duplicate of the selected content without deleting it.
  • It’s the most common and efficient way to copy text.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + X is used to cut text instead of copying.
  • Drag and drop moves text, but does not create a copy.
  • Find and Replace is used for replacing words or phrases, not copying and pasting.

question:
How do we combine regions from multiple authors into a single Microsoft Word 365 document?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Combine feature in MS Word 365 is used to merge revisions and edits from multiple authors into a single unified document .
  • It helps track and integrate changes when different users have edited separate copies.
  • This is commonly used during collaborative writing or editing processes.

Additional Information:

  • Compare is used to view differences between two documents.
  • Restrict Editing limits who can edit certain parts of the document.
  • Block Authors prevents editing of specific regions by certain users in shared documents.

question:
In Microsoft Word 365, what is the purpose of text formatting?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_3: Modifying the appearance of text
solution:
• In MS Word 365, text formatting is used to modify how the text appears , including font style, size,colour , bold, italic, underline, etc.
  • It helps to make the text more readable, attractive, and structured .
  • Formatting improves both visual appeal and clarity of the content.

Additional Information:

  • Changing the font is one part of text formatting, not the whole purpose.
  • Page layout involves margins, orientation, and spacing, which are separate features.
  • Decorative images fall under Insert options, not formatting.

question:
Which is used to save text temporarily when it is copied or cut in MS Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, when you copy (Ctrl + C) or cut (Ctrl + X) text, it is temporarily stored in the Clipboard .
  • The Clipboard allows you to paste (Ctrl + V) the content later at another location.
  • It acts as a temporary memory space for text, images, and objects.

Additional Information:

  • You can view the Clipboard pane from the Home tab→ Clipboard group .
  • The Clipboard can hold multiple copied items in Office 365.
  • Other options like Textboard,Copyboard , and Memoryboard are not valid features in MS Word.

question:
Which option in MS Word 365 allows saving the document in another location?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, Save As is used to save the current document with a new name or in a different location .
  • It allows you to create a copy of the document while preserving the original.
  • This is useful when you want to save different versions of the same file.

Additional Information:

  • Open is used to access an existing document.
  • New is used to create a new blank document.
  • Print sends the document to the printer, not for saving purposes.

question:
What is the purpose of the ‘Tell me what you want to do’ feature in Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: It automatically corrects formatting errors in the document.
option_2: It allows you to search for specific commands and features within the application.
option_3: It offers grammar and spelling suggestions for the selected text.
option_4: It provides a list of recent documents for quick access.
solution:
• The ‘Tell me what you want to do’ feature in MS Word 365 allows users to search for commands, tools, or help topics directly by typing in keywords.
  • It is especially helpful for quickly finding features without navigating through menus.
  • It saves time and improves workflow efficiency.

Additional Information:

  • Located at the top of the ribbon, marked by a light bulb icon or a search bar.
  • It’s different from spelling or grammar tools and does not correct text.
  • It enhances accessibility for new users unfamiliar with the full menu structure.

question:
What is the purpose of the ‘Help’ feature in Microsoft Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: It creates a backup copy of the document.
option_2: It opens a new blank document.
option_3: It allows you to print the current document.
option_4: It provides assistance and information about using Microsoft Word.
solution:
• The Help feature in Microsoft Word 365 provides assistance, guidance, and answers related to using various tools and features in Word.
  • It helps users learn how to perform specific tasks or troubleshoot issues.
  • The Help function can be accessed by pressing F1 or by clicking on the Help icon .

Additional Information:

  • It includes searchable topics , step-by-step guides , and links to online support .
  • It is especially useful for beginners or when exploring new features .
  • It does not open documents, print files, or create backups.

question:
In MS Word 365, which shortcut key moves to beginning of document?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, pressing Ctrl + Home moves the cursor directly to the beginning of the document .
  • It is a quick way to navigate to the start without scrolling.
  • This helps in editing, referencing, or reviewing from the top.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + End takes the cursor to the end of the document .
  • Ctrl + Ins is used for copy in some systems (legacy use).
  • Ctrl + Del deletes the word after the cursor .

question:
Shortcut key in MS Word 365 to move by one preview page?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_4: Page UP or Page Down
solution:
• In Print Preview or Read Mode of MS Word 365, Page Up moves to the previous preview page , and Page Down moves to the next preview page .
  • These keys help in navigating quickly between pages when zoomed out.
  • It works well in multi-page documents where scrolling is inefficient.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + Alt + I togglesthe Print Preview mode.
  • Ctrl + D opens the Font dialog box .
  • Ctrl + P opens the Print window , not for navigation.

question:
Shortcut key to open Font dialog box in MS Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, pressing Ctrl + Shift + F opens the Font dialog box , where you can change font style, size,colour , effects, and more.
  • It provides more detailed formatting options than the basic font toolbar.
  • This shortcut saves time while editing text formatting.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + F opens the Navigation pane to find text in the document.
  • Alt + F opens the File menu .
  • Ctrl + Alt + F inserts a footnote , not font settings.

question:
Which feature to use for help in MS Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Help feature in MS Word 365 is designed to assist users in troubleshooting issues or learning how to use various features .
  • You can type your query in the “Tell me what you want to do” box or press F1 to access Help.
  • It offers step-by-step guidance, articles, and tips.

Additional Information:

  • Review is used for spell check, comments, and tracking changes.
  • Insert is used to add elements like images, tables, or shapes.
  • Edit is a general term; no such tab exists as “Edit” in MS Word.

question:
Under which tab of MS Word 365 are Bullets and Numbering options?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Word 365, the Bullets and Numbering options are located under the Home tab , specifically in the Paragraph group .
  • These options allow users to create ordered (numbered) and unordered (bulleted) lists.
  • They helporganise information into readable and structured formats.

Additional Information:

  • The File tab is used for file-related actions like save, open, print, etc.
  • The Insert tab is used to add tables, images, charts, etc.
  • The Mailings tab is used for mail merge and envelope/label creation.

question:
What is the default page orientation in Microsoft Word 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The default page orientation in Microsoft Word 365 is Portrait , meaning the page is taller than it is wide .
  • This is best suited for most documents like letters, essays, and reports.
  • Users can change it to Landscape if needed via Layout→ Orientation .

Additional Information:

  • Landscape orientation is wider than it is tall and used for tables, charts, or horizontal layouts.
  • Square and Pentagon are not valid orientation options in Word.
  • Orientation affects printing and layout of the document.

question:
In MS Word 365, what is the key difference between copying and cutting text?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Copying requires the use of a keyboard shortcut, while cutting is performed by using the mouse.
option_2: Copying is reversible, while cutting is irreversible.
option_3: Copying duplicates the text to a new location, while cutting moves the text to a new location.
option_4: Copying removes the text from the original location, while cutting retains the text in the original location.
solution:
• In MS Word 365, the key difference is:

    Copy – duplicates the selected text or content without removing it from the original location.

    Cut – removes the selected text from its original location and allows it to be pasted elsewhere.

  • Both actions use clipboard memory and are often followed by the Paste command.

Additional Information:

  • Shortcut for Copy : Ctrl + C
  • Shortcut for Cut : Ctrl + X
  • Both actions are reversible using Undo (Ctrl + Z) if needed.
